page.title: 08Riding in the New Forest
page.content: Simm's Cottage Stables employs two full-time staff and two on a{Y.O.P. {Scheme.}This is a scheme whereby unemployed young people are offered work to gain experience in a particular field.The{Youth {Opportunities Programme}is financed by the government.{Lessons}cost Â£4.00 an hour for a group and for a private lesson it is Â£5.00.There are many types of horses such as a Shire cross,Welsh Cobb,half and pure Arab,New Forest ponies and one Thoroughbred.There are 26 horses altogether.In the winter they are fed sugar beet,bran and barley and in the summer oats,bran and barley.There are ten mares,sixteen geldings.The stable have cheaper rides for the{disabled} three times a week.Tuesdays and Thursdays for{Autistic}children and Wednesday for{Mongols.}
